Handles Time Column in a List of Data Frames

Source: R/utils_prepare_time.R
utils_prepare_time.Rd

Handles Time Column in a List of Data Frames

Usage

utils_prepare_time(x = NULL, time_column = NULL, lock_step = FALSE)

Arguments

x

(required, named list of data frames). List with named data frames. Default: NULL.

time_column

(optional if lock_step = FALSE, and required otherwise, column name) Name of numeric column representing time. Default: NULL.

lock_step

(optional, logical) If TRUE, all input sequences are subset to their common times according to the values in the time_column. Default: FALSE.

Value

List of data frames

See also

Other internal: utils_check_args_distantia(), utils_check_args_matrix(), utils_check_args_path(), utils_check_args_tsl(), utils_check_args_zoo(), utils_check_distance_args(), utils_check_list_class(), utils_clean_names(), utils_digits(), utils_distantia_df_split(), utils_distantia_df_to_matrix(), utils_prepare_df(), utils_prepare_matrix(), utils_prepare_matrix_list(), utils_prepare_vector_list(), utils_prepare_zoo_list(), utils_tsl_pairs()
